alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Jefferson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark and north central Jefferson Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles west of Helena to 15 miles northwest of Basin. Movement was east northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, East Helena, Montana City, Marysville, York, Rimini, Spring Meadow Lake State Park, Canyon Creek, Black Sandy State Park and Austin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 184 and 219. Highway 12 between mile markers 29 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southwestern and west central Montana.
